Speaker: five marines
Dialogue: From the 1st Platoon, 2nd battalion, 5th Marines .. Camo uniforms, NIGHT VISION GOGGLES on, stare into the DARK. CPL. CORREGGIO, 20, linebacker-big, shakes his head, frustrated.

Speaker: anna
Dialogue: Call me later.

Speaker: cherise
Dialogue: For three hundred more, she said we could have sprays of lilies. I know it's a lot, but it'd be so beautiful. What d'you think, baby? Harris looks pained. But before he can speak up:

Speaker: psychiatrist
Dialogue: Still not sleeping... And the nightmares?

Speaker: psychiatrist
Dialogue: You're not drinking, right, private? That's just a crutch...

Speaker: captain
Dialogue: These objects were completely undetected until they entered our atmosphere.

Speaker: captain
Dialogue: We have no idea. But whatever they are, they're not hitting the water at terminal velocity. They're able to slow down before impact. Glances exchanged in the room now.

Speaker: captain
Dialogue: This is no meteor shower. Homeland Security has bumped the threat level to red. Marines, we are the first line of defense. All units gear up, be ready to move.

Speaker: the marines
Dialogue: Push forward, scrambling to the TVs.

Speaker: televisions
Dialogue: The REPORTER ON THE BEACH staring out, clearly panicked.

Speaker: televisions
Dialogue: As the REPORTER reacts to isolated SHOUTS echoing from the crowd on the beach. Some are pointing out to the ocean...

Speaker: captain
Dialogue: Situation is as follows: Most of Santa Monica is cleared of civilians. We've got a defensive line at Lincoln Boulevard a mile from the ocean... He points out LINCOLN BOULEVARD on a MAP, the OCEAN close by.

Speaker: captain
Dialogue: At 9 p.m., everything from Lincoln to the ocean will be bombed. Martinez blanches.

Speaker: captain
Dialogue: We've got an infestation of god- knows-what. It's an enemy ground force only, they have no aircraft. So our jets'll tear 'em a new asshole. We will rule the air.

Speaker: captain
Dialogue: That's affirm. We're getting distress calls, sending squads out. He points to the MAP, to streets running from Lincoln Blvd.

Speaker: captain
Dialogue: Your mission, Lieutenant, take your 1st squad, proceed west from Lincoln to a community center located here...  In a park on 10th and Bay Street. Police were using it as an evacuation point. They got overrun. Get there, any civilians you find, get 'em back here to the FOB for evacuation. You got three hours. Another CHOPPER is LANDING. Nantz yells over the sound:

Speaker: captain
Dialogue: Not much. But police have shot 'em. They bleed. The captain, hurrying to the next chopper, yells back:

Speaker: captain
Dialogue: It's our job to kill 'em.

Speaker: adukwu
Dialogue: Shit, I'd rather be in Afghanistan.

Speaker: marine
Dialogue: 2nd squad, 3rd platoon...

Speaker: marine
Dialogue: This is it, Lieutenant. Everyone else is dead or missing. The news hits Martinez hard. He eyes Nantz.

Speaker: marine
Dialogue: We were on the street, like, ten minutes and they ambushed us. As soon as we radioed for help, it's like they were everywhere...

Speaker: michele
Dialogue: There's five of us. Three kids. Nantz is immediately moving.

Speaker: crewman
Dialogue: You called in with two wounded!

Speaker: crewman
Dialogue: Can't take four! We have no room!

Speaker: crew chief
Dialogue: Now! We're moving now! Imlay bumps fists with Lenihan, backs away as...

Speaker: adukwu
Dialogue: All those guys on the chopper...

Speaker: amy
Dialogue: You're not gonna leave us, are you? A beat. Then Imlay smiles.

Speaker: rincon
Dialogue: My son and I came here... There were only three cops, spread pretty thin... Then those things attacked. Police couldn't stop them.

Speaker: rincon
Dialogue: I don't know. Most people ran. We hid in a side room, found Michele and the girls... Couldn't see what happened. Just heard... Screams.

Speaker: michele
Dialogue: I have my nieces for the week. My sister and her husband are in Hawaii for their anniversary... Is it safe there? I heard this is happening in other places... Martinez is at a loss for words.

Speaker: michele
Dialogue: What do they want from us? Why are they here?

Speaker: hector
Dialogue: Want some Nerds? Imlay holds his hand out. Hector shakes candy into it as... Nantz enters, calling to Adukwu:

Speaker: michele
Dialogue: Maybe I can help, sergeant. I'm a vet...

Speaker: michele
Dialogue: No, a veterinarian.

Speaker: michele
Dialogue: Michele.

Speaker: michele
Dialogue: I was more sure two minutes ago. She looks to Adukwu. They step to the body together as... Nantz approaches Martinez.

Speaker: adukwu
Dialogue: Well, Lieutenant, I'm a medic, Dr. McDermott's a vet... We weren't sure who was most qualified to cut this thing open. Martinez smiles.

Speaker: adukwu
Dialogue: Look. It's been surgically modified... He pulls tissue aside, revealing where the alien's 'gun' is attached to its arm.

Speaker: adukwu
Dialogue: Part of its arm has been amputated to fit this weapon.

Speaker: kirsten
Dialogue: My... pony holder? Nantz nods. She pulls the PONY TAIL HOLDER from her hair, hands it to Nantz. He smiles. Briefly. Heads to the front.

Speaker: michele
Dialogue: Your head, Sergeant. You're bleeding. Nantz touches his head, looks at the blood. He wipes it on his pants. Michele smiles at him softly.

Speaker: michele
Dialogue: Bet when you woke up this morning, you didn't think your day would end up like this.

Speaker: hector
Dialogue: Are we gonna die? Nantz turns back to Hector. Manages a smile.

Speaker: adukwu
Dialogue: Okay, it's clear. We're gonna go. Amy and Kirsten, terrified, look up at Michele. She hurries the girls to the door of the bus as Kern runs up.

Speaker: michele
Dialogue: It's okay. I'll be right behind you. Adukwu picks up Amy. Kerns picks up Kirsten.

Speaker: rincon
Dialogue: It's okay, son. I got you.

Speaker: rincon
Dialogue: What do I need to know? The slightest beat, then...

Speaker: rincon
Dialogue: Just sight down the barrel...?

Speaker: rincon
Dialogue: Listen to me, son. I'm not going to make it.  But you will.

Speaker: hector
Dialogue: I don't want to go without you.

Speaker: rincon
Dialogue: I know. But you have to. Now wait with Michele a minute. Let me talk to the sergeant. Reluctantly, Hector allows Michele to lead him away.

Speaker: rincon
Dialogue: No. You can't take me. Nantz is silent, at a loss.

Speaker: rincon
Dialogue: I keep playing it over in my head... If I'd done things differently... Maybe I could have gotten Hector out earlier.

Speaker: rincon
Dialogue: Just promise you'll get my son out of here, Sergeant. Nantz looks like he has the weight of the world on him.

Speaker: rincon
Dialogue: I'm trusting you with the only thing I have in this world. Nantz stares, nods.

Speaker: rincon
Dialogue: I'm very proud of you, son. You're being so brave... Hector throws his arms around his father, hugging him tightly.

Speaker: rincon
Dialogue: I love you, Hector. Mr. Rincon smiles. His face peaceful. Hector is silent, tears rolling down his face.

Speaker: michele
Dialogue: What's happening, Sergeant? What's that mean?

Speaker: hector
Dialogue: I don't wanna be here. I want my dad back. I want it all to go back to the way it was before...

Speaker: nantz
Dialogue: Tries to lead Hector away. Hector struggles.

Speaker: michele
Dialogue: What's the matter?

Speaker: hector
Dialogue: People always say that. "He's a hero."

Speaker: hector
Dialogue: What's that mean, "retreat hell?"

Speaker: michele
Dialogue: You don't look much older, either. She gazes at the kids, pain and anger washing over her.

Speaker: michele
Dialogue: Is this day ever going to end?

Speaker: adukwu
Dialogue: Emmanuel. Manny.

Speaker: michele
Dialogue: I'm single. Lots of family back in Nebraska, though... Hopefully they're safe... She shakes the thought away.

Speaker: michele
Dialogue: What about you guys?

Speaker: adukwu
Dialogue: Nigeria. I came here to be a doctor.

Speaker: michele
Dialogue: You should be a surgeon, the way you cut into that thing... Adukwu smiles. Then his smile fades as he looks around.

Speaker: adukwu
Dialogue: Yeah. Maybe...

Speaker: sgt nantz
Dialogue: Get us there. Cause we're about to get lit up. The alien drone ships are winging at them. They are only 200 meters out when...

Speaker: crew chief
Dialogue: You are in the middle of the shit, Sergeant! Everything's been pulled back.

Speaker: crew chief
Dialogue: We've lost most of our air assets. We're abandoning Los Angeles. This city's done...!  Let's go! The chopper powers up, Nantz SCRAMBLES ON with the others.

Speaker: crew chief
Dialogue: Something there was playing hell with our power! Nantz stares at this. Then notices Hector watching. him. He sees the 2/5 MEDALLION clutched tightly in Hector's hand. Speaker: crew chief
Dialogue: What?! The other marines in Nantz' unit look over, alarmed now.

Speaker: crew chief
Dialogue: We can't land! May not have power to take off again... Nantz looks out. Spies a BUILDING with a FLAT OPEN ROOF. He points to it.

Speaker: hector
Dialogue: What are you gonna do?

Speaker: marines
Dialogue: Yes, Sergeant!

Speaker: nantz
Dialogue: I think you men earned the right to call yourselves marines today. I'm damn proud of every one of you. Retreat!?
